init_text:
Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion,

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: people aren't bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news, but I do think there is a sense of civic duty where keeping up with

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: If somebody doesn't care what is going on or doesn't want to know, that's fine.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: But I think as a citizen, it's worthwhile to try and occasionally be informed.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I don't know that any one person can actually do anything to change the larger social issues, but I think it's worthwhile as a way to participate

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: If you have a chance to speak up about political issues at work, or at school, or locally, I think you should.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: If you don't, though, I don't think you're doing anything wrong.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I think the things that are happening far away shouldn't bind anybody to feel like they're a bad person if they aren't actively talking or writing about

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: a political issue or community they aren't directly involved in.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: If you have a choice, sure, the world could use another person with an opinion and a chance to write something for the internet, but it's

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: not like you're doing anything wrong by caring more about the local community, or work, or family, or friends.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Do you think that the things that are happening in the news are actually affecting your life or this society in any significant way?

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Do you think if you keep up with the news and get involved in politics you can make any real difference?

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Does this type of awareness effect your life at all in a positive or negative way?

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: My personal answers would be “Yes”, “Nope” and “Yeah”.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: My life is being impacted by the fact that our president just spewed overtly racist statements about immigrants.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Our society is impacted by this and will be even more so as the news travels around the world.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: No. I can have my opinions and hopes and dreams, but I can't vote in the government or do anything that will effectively change policy in any

actions.name: text-delete
actions.text: My personal answers would be “Yes”, “Nope” and “Yeah”.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: What I can do is do things to help me feel like I'm an active participant in the world.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I talk to strangers when I'm out in public instead of sitting at my table and being an introvert.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I try to stay informed about local and state politics.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I try to make safe spaces for people of various backgrounds and try to speak up when I see bigotry.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I know I can't make any real change and that the world is big and scary and overwhelming, but I like feeling like my words

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: and actions are at least a small part of the picture.
